snippet: Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates and Bahrain took the step in protest over Qatar’s continued support of the Muslim Brotherhood and other Islamists in the region.
abstract: Saudi Arabia, United Arab Emirates and Bahrain withdraw their ambassadors from Qatar over its support of the Muslim Brotherhood and allied Islamists around the region; concerted effort to isolate Qatar is an extraordinary rebuke of its strategy of aligning with moderate Islamists in the hope of extending its influence amid the Arab Spring revolts.
lead_paragraph: Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates and Bahrain took the step in protest over Qatar’s continued support of the Muslim Brotherhood and other Islamists in the region.

headline.main: 3 Gulf Countries Pull Ambassadors From Qatar Over Its Support of Islamists
headline.print_headline: 3 Gulf Countries Pull Ambassadors From Qatar Over Its Support of Islamists

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
